body: Call SetCapture when a mouse button is pressed (and none is already pressed). Call ReleaseCapture when all buttons are released.

issue.title: Focusing a window when its rendering region is clicked has been broken on Windows
issue.body:
So, you've got a SFML 2.1 window (I'm using Windows 7 x64) and it is not focused, but it is still partially visible because maybe you have a notepad window overlapping it.
You've finished looking at your notepad window and want to get back to the SFML window.
So, you click on the window's rendering region so it comes into focus. What? It does not work.

I loaded up some old SFML 2.0 application compiled with some old version of SFML that was probably a little before 6/18/13.
It works exactly as I expect. When I click the window's rendering region, the window comes into focus.
I guess that at some point in the time period, a patch was given to SFML that broke this.

I am just using the SFML 2.1 rendering window documentation code and am able to replicate the issue.

issue.title: Fixed mouse clicks not activating windows (Win32)
issue.body:
- This fixes issue #437, except Alt+F4, which would be a different issue?
- This is essentially based around @All8Up's suggestion.
- The new member variable `m_focused` is meant to be exposed later on so the user is able to determine whether the window is active without doing separate event tracking.
- Activating mouse clicks aren't passed to the event queue. This is something not really consistent across games or applications in general, but I prefer this behavior (avoids triggering anything by accident).

issue.title: Global Exception catch with Win32 MsgBox causes Event-blocking
issue.body: I have got a global try-catch-block in my main-method where the game loops run. In the catch-block I call MessageBoxA() to notify the exception to the user. Any Interaction with the mouse is blocked: I can neither move the messagebox nor click on the OK button. But after If I move the sfml-mainwindow with the mouse, I can close the messagebox with the mouse correctly. Strangely, keyboard works without moving the sfml window.

issue.title: Trapping/Clipping the Mouse Cursor
issue.body:
This implementation fixes the request discussed in issue #394 and is fully functional for Windows, but its still lacking its Linux/MacOS counterparts.

I picked the current naming scheme (`trapMouseCursor()` and `freeMouseCursor()`) instead of using some `setCursorTrapped()`, because it might be interesting to allow some custom rectangle to be passed as an optional parameter (overload?).

I'll try to create the X11 implementation myself, if noone volunteers, but I'll have to leave the MacOS one, because I've got no way to do or test this one.
